website_summaries.verdict: A very good adapter for older sound systems, this receiver isn’t keeping up with newer smartphone models in compatibility, limiting its functionality.
pros: Instant setup, with no buttons to press
Pairs immediately with compatible sound systems like the Bose SoundDock
cons: Device will power down after a few minutes of idling
Sound quality decreases slightly through receiver
Pairing with newer iPhones is problematic

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Works for my Bose soundock II - I was feeling super annoyed because the iphone 7 needs that stupid adaptor to connect to my car radio and bose at home. But now there's no need for a cable at all. Its great. I also connected it to my apple tv. It took a solid 5 minutes for the speaker to connect and I was worried, but I can turn my tv off and back on and it is immediately connected to the speaker, no waiting. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Great Device. Hello again, SoundDock II
customer_reviews.text: This little device is great! I (and a friend) tested it on two different Bose Sounddock models (2008+) with no unusual issues. Any problems we had originated on the mobile devices we were streaming music from, but that's not uncommon for Bluetooth connections. SUGGESTION: make certain you have it pushed down all the way on the connector. On the first try, I didn't seat it properly and I didn't get a response. After that, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: John Arthur Lee (fiction writer)

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!! Connected immediately. Must have!!
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this into my sound dock on my bose entertainment system. I have the full 9 speaker system. The lights started to flash, I hit my bluetooth search on my phone and it instantly found it, paired and i turned on Iheart and instant music. My tv displays ipod connection error but I am assuming it will. I walked ober 50 feet away from it and it never lost signal. This thing is awesome, I have been bothering bose about something exactly like this. Now I dont have to spend the $$$$$$ bose would charge.
customer_reviews.author: amanda eric

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise an excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews I was hoping that this device would be able to help me connect by Bluetooth on my iPhone 7 to my Bose Sounddock 10. IJust as soon as I hooked it up I have a pairing on my phone and to my surprise it worked perfectly. I was quite relieved because for some reason the iPhone 7 was not compatible with my Bose Sounddock 10. The only problem that I would consider maybe changing on the device is the fact that you can not remotely pair Bluetooth devices without taking the device off the Bose and then replacing it onto the pins. Otherwise an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard

customer_reviews.title: The BMR A2DP Bluetooth Music Receiver with its increased range is the perfect solution and works very well and I now have ...
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but felt the need as this device really delivered. I have an inhouse wired audio system with a legacy 30pin iPod dock and rather than shell out for $1000s for a proprietary wireless extender I thought a 30pin blue tooth adaptor might do the trick. Just one problem, the range on most of these system is limited and kept dropping the connection. The BMR A2DP Bluetooth Music Receiver with its increased range is the perfect solution and works very well and I now have it linked to my Amazon Echo and has provided a stable connection for several weeks. Excellent device
customer_reviews.author: steven heal

customer_reviews.title: #BMRRocks
customer_reviews.text: With this device I’m able to continue to use the 30 pin Bose docking station. The device connects to my tablets Bluetooth. Which is great, I love the sound of my Bose Docking Station, happy their is a device available. Volume: with the device I have to turn up the volume, not the same when the old 30pin phone is used. This is one issue, not a show stopper. Turn off: not sure if it turns off. Read that device can be damaged if not removed properly. Overall, the device serves my purpose, which is to continue using my 30 pin Bose Speaker without a 30 pin iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play Bluetooth for my SoundDock
customer_reviews.text: I was not very happy when Apple moved to their lighting connector which meant buying an adapter to connect my iphone. This bluetooth adapter works great. I now have the ability to play my music and control it from my phone including volume control. Nice when sitting across the room. The additional advantage of this device is I can now wirelessly connect my laptop and any other bluetooth capable device. One tip - in order to link to a device I find it's best to unplug the adapter and replug it into the sounddock and than sync to the device.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solution to keep the Sound Dock going
customer_reviews.text: We bought a Bose Sound dock with the 30 pin connection for an iPod about 6 years ago for our condo. We love the sound and generally used apps such as Pandora and Tunein Radio to play music and listen to our favorite programs. The iPod was frozen at iOS6 so apps didn't function well or couldn't be installed. For the price, we tried this product to see if we could keep the Sound Dock going. It's incredible! Easy-to-use, works perfectly, the Bluetooth connection comes up fast and is reliable! No more dropping off the WiFil. Right now, we're connecting through an older iPad but it's great to know that we can connect through any number of Bluetooth devices.
customer_reviews.author: dnagine

customer_reviews.title: Allows us to keep using Bose sounddock
customer_reviews.text: Our original Ipod player still works, but I knew when it quit, it was not replaceable. The dock has nothing but the obsolete 30 pin input, and this little adapter allows us to use smart phones to bluetooth our music. Sort of an insurance for our purchased music. I'd hoped it would work with my Mac Mini, but sadly, they won't connect even from just 12 feet apart, so it loses one star. My next cell will be an Iphone, I guess. We love the full rich sound of the docking station, and this little tool allows us to keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Works w/ Sony RDPXF100IP 30-Pin
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sony RDPXF100IP 30-Pin iPhone/iPod Portable Speaker Dock. So far so good. It is working. I haven't tested it out for distance. But it does connect via my iPhone 8 plus. The sound isn't as good as when I connected with our very old iPhone 3 may it RIP :) however now at least I can use it again! Yay! Pro's Connected Easy to use Saved us from buying a new dock Works with Sony RDPXF100IP 30-Pin Con's No off switch Sound quality is ok I DO recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: The Shopping Wiser Family

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my home music listening options
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a Bose Sounddock for years and I love it. Unfortunately, the connection is for the old style apple products. I haven’t updated my iPod in over 5 years so the sound dock wasn’t getting much use. I bought this little thing and am now happy to stream music from my phone. Super easy to set up; I didn’t even look at the directions.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Windey

customer_reviews.title: These items worked perfectly and I was glad to have my Bose back on the scene
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the BMR A2DP and then needed the BMP 30 Pin power adapter - the A2DP will not work without the power adapter - save yourself the trouble and buy them both! These items worked perfectly and I was glad to have my Bose back on the scene. There is a tiny bit of frequency interference noise which is easily fixed if you turn your Bose down and phone up. However, my love of this product is short-lived. It is no longer working, neither piece, at all. Just quit working after five weeks.
customer_reviews.author: A.Frasher

customer_reviews.title: How did I not know about this!?
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have known about this adapter sooner! I've had my first Bose SoundDock for a few years now and love it for the older generation iPod as it charges while playing music. However I always wanted the mobility of having the iPod/iPhone with me for the ease of changing stations/songs. So I went out and bought the Bose SoundLink, not knowing I could attach this adapter and use Bluetooth on my SoundDock! Works great so far, I have no complaints. For anyone with a Bose SoundDock II, I highly recommend this if you're seeking a Bluetooth option!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brueckmann

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older BOSE powered speaker with a 30 pin input. I was ready to drop kick it. I purchased this an it works as advertised. Updated my system and now l use it everyday. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Barbagallo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to update your Bose SoundDock!! No cables! Great performance
customer_reviews.text: This product works so good with my bose SoundDock. I was about to buy a new Bose that had Bluetooth and ran into this product by accident. It works very very good, super simple to use and pair with the cellphones or Ipods in my house. I finally can get rid if the audio cable that I had to use every time I had people over and can control the music via Bluetooth from the kitchen or the living room. I love my Bose Sound dock and this $20 usd device gave it a new life. I only got to spend $20 usd instead of another $150 for a smaller Bose with Bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: VIOLETA

customer_reviews.title: High Quality device that works
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to try this bluetooth adapter due to the low-quality pictures on this page, but I can assure you that it does work well. This is the second bluetooth adapter I've tried and this one works perfectly with my Sony clock radio. The instructions are a little difficult to understand, but once everything is connected it sounds great. It connects up fine with Galaxy S5, my wife's iPhone 6s, and an older Galaxy tablet, which is the primary device I use to stream music.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Bose SoundDock II with MacBook Pro- if you're having trouble, read this
customer_reviews.text: I use this to play music through an older Bose SoundDock II. Works pretty easily with my ipad and iphone but the Macbook can be a little finicky for some reason. It noticed it helps sometimes to unplug the adapter and then reattach it (not the electrical cord, the actual adapter). More importantly, I REALIZED IT CAN ONLY BE PAIRED TO 2 DEVICES AT ONE TIME! It was pairing with my Roku player and my iphone automatically and that was causing me not to be able to connect my Macbook until I disconnected my phone, then it worked perfectly. Overall, this was a really good buy because it allowed me to use my older Bose speaker.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Better than buying a new adapter every time the tech changes
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful solution to the problem of ever-changing adapters. While you cannot charge your device with this adapter, you can always just plug it in while playing through it. Simple and intuitive to use. You do need to take it off and put it back on (unless I'm missing something) between uses to get it to recognize your device after you haven't used it for a while (the equivalent of power-cycling, I think). I recommend this rather than fussing with buying an adapter that may or may not work (the ones I bought that worked for my car stereo and my iHome speaker did not work for the Bose).
customer_reviews.author: tlk

customer_reviews.title: I have my Bose back!!!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to be listening to great music thru my Bose SoundDock again. The original SoundDock did not come with an external jack so if you did not have a 30 pin device or adapter you could not use it. I still had my old iPod around for listening in the kitchen, but my most updated music was on my Android phone. I found this Bluetooth adapter while searching for a new speaker option. I am so glad I did. It works great and was way less expensive than a replacement speaker would have been. I only wish it was available in white as I have the white/silver SoundDock. Thanks for giving me back my music!
customer_reviews.author: Captivated

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This was our second purchase of the BR A2DP bluetooth 4.1 music receiver adaptor. Both times the same issue occured. First the adaptor begins to need to be unplugged and plugged back in every time we want to use it. Eventually the item just quits working. And there is no way to get a hold of the company from Amazon's website that I can find. Waste of money. Update: September 1, 2019 The company did send a replacement for the second adaptor. But it likewise broke in less than 6 months. I am NOT reckless with my possessions. This adaptor is not touched except to turn it on. I use it about once a week. I expect better.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly because I had researched my Bose Sound dock.
customer_reviews.text: Bose didn't make it easy to figure out, as other reviewers have said. Their serial numbers aren't researchable on the Bose website. My owner's manual was not helpful, even looking at the printing date. I used other reviewer's helpful info regarding features found on units before 2008 and after, and some online research. Mine was made right around 2008 and had some features used to identify it from both designs, so it was an educated guess. I guessed right so did not need the other component. Set up was easy and worked as described. Nice to resurrect the great speaker again.
customer_reviews.author: Calif chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Reliable Pairing to Bose Portable Sound Dock
customer_reviews.text: Unlike many wireless gadgets, this Bluetooth BMR device connected my Bose Portable Sound Dock (30 pin) easily and almost immediately to my IPhone 6 and IPad Air II. You must disconnect one device from the BMR before pairing another device. Simply go to Settings-Bluetooth-Tap the BMR Device Connected and tap Disconnect. Then proceed to connecting your other device. Amazingly brought my old Bose Dock out of the mothballs.
customer_reviews.author: chromey

customer_reviews.title: Item did not work
customer_reviews.text: The item I received did not work. it did not power in either of my speakers. I purchased to replaced another adapter that I had for a long time and loved it, but I accidentally broke it. I requested a refund online, had to take it to Khol's and was refunded promptly. I purchased a different brand and I am very happy with the new one.
customer_reviews.author: L. O. Branch

customer_reviews.title: Rocking this rating away!!! ;)
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and we love it...paired it to our phones, laptop and tablets....you can hear your phone call over the speaker when in use....so you may be forced to break the signal until the call is done to maintain privacy....either way...this allows for great freedom when playing your music through bluetooth devices.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFIC PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: So easy, quick and efficient to use! I was so sad when my old BT adapter stopped working with my Bose speaker (an oldie but GOODIE Bose speaker!). What a relief when this little gizmo arrived. Literally, I snapped it on the speaker, searched on my iphone 7s for the BT device and voila! YAY ME! And, thank you to whomever developed this BT ADAPTER! It's a snap to use and I'd highly recommend it to you if you're considering purchasing this product. Don't throw out your old BOSE! They don't make 'em like that any longer! One happy customer here!
customer_reviews.author: MINE4COAL

customer_reviews.title: Easy hookup and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: It's great and all too unusual today when a product does exactly what it is advertised to do! This amazing piece of equipment gave new life to my Bose Sounddock. It is now successfully being used as a wireless auxiliary speaker system to my Amazon Echo! It took about 3 minutes to hookup and it works perfectly. No issues. I can't describe how pleased I am.
customer_reviews.author: jnadrig

customer_reviews.title: Plastic case got lose after a few days.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice way to bring some new life to these old speakers which have awesome sound quality. The adapter itself works well, initial setup and pairing is easy with an iPhone 6. But unfortunately the case that hides the circuit board came off extremely easy for me (anf that is what causes the one star) It still works normally when I plug the circuit board nakef directly to the slot, but I wish it could have held it together in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: MDeB

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth adaptor for our 30 pin Bose radio.
customer_reviews.text: I bough this to replace one I bought at Target a few years ago. I gave it away to a friend who needed it and I turned to amazon to replace it. This had good reviews but it's hard to tell until you actually have it and use it. This one is WAY better than the one we gave away. This one is much more "plug and play" the old one was harder to connect each time we wanted to use it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: the receiver felt like a cheap
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly but only works with my Logitech speaker while it is plugged into power outlet. I need a bluetooth receiver that works while using the speaker wirelessly and this product failed to do that. I purchased the item because the description claimed that the receiver was compatible with my specific Logitech model - this was not 100% accurate. The product as returned and price refunded without issue. FWIW, the receiver felt like a cheap, hollow plastic box. It is probably the same exact product as the unbranded BT receivers that are available at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boland

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Usually to good to be true is just that. Pricing was great but it didn't work. Comes with two informational documents that tell you to identify the year your Bose product was made. Good luck finding that out. Then if it doesn't work, which it didn't, they tell to buy more add on products. It even goes so far as to say if you give them under a 4-star rating to write them a letter! Needless to say, does anyone write letters anymore? Just don't waste your time as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Device added new life to my Bose wave radio ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Device added new life to my Bose wave radio with a cd player. Thought it wasn't working at first, but had to check my volume on my iphone 6. Used this in my Bose Docking station for my ipod, and now Eureka, all of Pandora is available. The BMR A2DP Bluetooth 4.1 Music Receiver Adapter also connects to my Bose Home Lifestyle surround sound system. Something you just don't like, or love it, BUT You Gotta Have It. Regards, BMRMT. I need more spare time to enjoy all types of music now. And thats GREAT !
customer_reviews.author: ZATZME

customer_reviews.title: New Life for My Old Bose Speaker
customer_reviews.text: This gave life to my old-school Bose speaker that was only compatible with a 1st gen iPod. I can now stream music from my iPhone. Make sure you get the right power adapter (e.g. 30 pin, sold separately) in addition to the Bluetooth receiver. It shouldn’t cost more than 40 bucks total and is super-easy to pair devices!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - Good Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received fell apart so I contacted BMR and they quickly sent me a replacement. They said they had received some with faulty glue and apologized for the inconvenience. The replacement arrived and worked without issue. I can now use my Bose without some lightning adapter that usually lasts me less than a year before breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Small

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This product is very easy to use and install. I have a 30-pin apple connector which is connected to my car stereo. After switching to iPhone 5's I got this product instead so that I wouldn't have to change my existing set up. A couple of things: 1) if you have a very old 30-pin accessory that uses FireWire charging, you need to purchase the version of this product that comes with the power adapter. 2) if you hook this up to a car stereo, you will likely need a ground loop isolator to get rid of the annoying high pitched whine. This is especially bad when charging your device since the two circuits share the same ground.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lee

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. I have a Bose where you put the Iphone 4 on it. It charges and you can play music. When they changed the pins on the phones, I didn't know how I could use my Bose. I found an adapter that lets me use the speaker via Bluetooth. The adapter gave up the ghost after a couple of years and I found this one. Cheaper and Better. So glad
customer_reviews.author: Debi

customer_reviews.title: BMR A2DP Bluetooth Adapter is AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for those who have Bose sound dock with A30 pin connection but play device does not. After we upgraded our I phones, we were no longer able to dock our play device because they have smaller charge pin connection. The A2DP Bluetooth Music Receiver Adapter for Bose Sound Dock Speakers has allowed us to continue enjoying our Bose speaker system. The A2DP Bluetooth receiver works awesome. We Love It....Highly Recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: jeff_prev

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it ! Original BOSE Soundock is ALIVE AGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: This product is the BEST !!!! It made my old Original Bose soundock come back to LIFE !!!!! I thought this soundock was going to be collecting dust for the rest of history but guess what !!?? IT SOUNDS AWSOME !!! This Bluetooth receiver FEEDS POWER FROM THE Soundock !! No power adapter needed, just plug and play. My iPhone Bluetooth "saw" it pretty easy and fast with no digital bureaucracy !! LOL HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !
customer_reviews.author: Morella

customer_reviews.title: Brought my old SoundDock back to life!
customer_reviews.text: My Bose SoundDock had become a useless device once I upgraded my iPhone. This device saved my beloved SoundDock. I am now enjoying the Bose again! Easy to set up. Pairs with the phone quickly. It was also more compact than I envisioned, which makes it very unobtrusive. A very nice little device.
customer_reviews.author: Amdel

customer_reviews.title: Totally pleased! Wonderful conversion device.
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the other adapter that I needed, this worked great! We used it to play my Bose Sound Dock from an Amazon playlist at my daughter's outdoor/indoor wedding reception. With this fix we saved a bunch on a DJ -- we were our own DJ -- and played every song we wanted. Kudos!
customer_reviews.author: Catman1111

customer_reviews.title: Makes a worthless Bose speaker priceless again!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm just as advertised. Connecting to Bluetooth was very easy also. I am using my Bose sound dock again as I was about ready to take it to the pawn shop and get whatever I could for it and now it's like a just bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: Troy S

customer_reviews.title: Only two minor flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The sound quality is amazing. Super easy to sync up to my IPhone 4/6 and my wireless desktop computer. It’s small and sleek. Simple instructions. Con: The BT receiver turns off automatically after inactivity to a device. Clearly a 1st world problem but, it’s a nuisance to walk up to the receiver, unplug it and plug it back in to “wake it up” which then it can reconnect to your devices. Also, you can’t rename the receiver or lock it out to others.
customer_reviews.author: M.P

customer_reviews.title: This product works great. I am able to play music from my ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. I am able to play music from my iPhone 5 to the original Sounddock Bose via bluetooth with this device which is even better since I can still use my phone while the music plays. I had a little problem setting up at first but the owner from BRMMusicTechnology was very helpful in getting me back on track. The one thing you need to be sure is that your Bose is not older than 2009. If it is then you will need a power adapter to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: SquareDee

customer_reviews.title: Blue tooth connector for Bose IPod use speakers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and connected perfectly with my old IPod dock on my Bose speakers. All I had to do was plug it into the IPod connector/charger and it synced up easily. I use it to pick up my internet radioi stations on my IPhone wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy O.

customer_reviews.title: This Device Is Super Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using my Bose speaker system again. I stopped using my iPod long ago and the system set without me touching it for over one-year. It is too nice of a speaker system to just catch dust and when I found this adapter I knew I had found a game-changer. I've had it one day at the time of this review and used it this morning before work. I paired it with my phone the night prior and the pairing was really easy. While I don't have a lot of hours using the adapter now I sure plan to have many enjoyable hours in the days and months ahead. This is a very nice development in electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy E McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up-plug and play!
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my Bose Sound Dock-30 pin apple connector. Adapter flashed red and blue, paired my iPhone to the adapter. I started playing music from my iPhone and the sound came from my Bose Sound Dock speaker. Easy! Also paired my wife's iPhone with it so she could use it as well.
customer_reviews.author: wlee

customer_reviews.title: Nice way to bring that 30 pin Bose system up ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice way to bring that 30 pin Bose system up to date with newer iPhone. I was prepared to be skeptical because it is so inexpensive but it booted up exactly as advertised and I can stream my phone to the Bose from across the room. Done and done.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly impressed!
customer_reviews.text: When my wife first found this, I will be the first to admit I was skeptical of how good the quality of sound would be. Like everyone else, we have purchased mass-market cell accessories only to fork out more money later for the same, albeit more expensive name brand product. However, I was wrong on this one. Very impressed with the quality and clarity- you'd think it was a genuine Apple product. We've used it with our home theater system and portable Bosr dock, and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 similar product and this one is by far the best. It has the longest range, the loudest volume and cheapest price! Outstanding. FYI - I tried the CoolStream Duo; good product but less volume and nearly twice the price (the Cool Stream has built-in battery and an auxiliary port, which is a nice feature but not something I was interested in). I also tried Aluratek (purchased at Best Buy for $30). This was the worst with humming at loud volume. Bottom line: save a few dollars and get great performance.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond thrilled with this adapter and the price! I literally had my Bose speaker in a give-away box and pulled it out at the last minute. I don't use my ipod anymore and have an android phone - so it was collecting dust. Expensive dust collector y'know. Little did I know there was a world where blue tooth adapters live. I am not techy yet I unpacked this little 1 inch x 1 inch problem solver and immediately paired my android phone and my macbook pro. We're back in business! Thank you BMR!
customer_reviews.author: 2kayak

customer_reviews.title: Great distance with bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Not bad gets annoying to plug and unplug this item for Bluetooth to connect but works. The distance is really good for Bluetooth signal a lot better than typical 30 foot range
customer_reviews.author: hoodi who

customer_reviews.title: Connect to any phone or pad now
customer_reviews.text: I can connect any device to my Bose now by bluetooth. Only problem is I can't figure how to turn it on and off. The Bose I can, but to get a phone to connect, I have to unplug this adapter, plug it back in, then the phone can see and connect. Should be just a button or something to make it "active" and available to connect. No more buying adapters specific to whatever phone I upgrade to, this will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Allison G.

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: This product worked like a charm when I first bought it a couple of years ago. But then it stopped pairing with most devices. And now, when I went to remove it from my Bose speaker it just fell apart - the plastic casing just lifted off completely and all the components fell out.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but I had to write this one. I was skeptical at first, but it works! I have an old Bose Sounddock and an even older iPad 2. The sound is crisp and the response time is very quick. I thought my Sounddock was outdated, but with this adapter, it has suddenly taken a second life!
customer_reviews.author: Otto123

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Android compatible.  Great Sound.
customer_reviews.text: I got my Bose sounddock as a gift but was highly disappointed since I'm not an iPhone person. I used an adapter and docked my iPad mini for a while...or was using the input jacknwhich was a huge hassle. Then I came across this adapter. WOW. I use my android for music and this is a godsend. The sound is identical. Great product. I'm not sure if cheaper versions do the same job, but this one was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Y.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than those Lightning cords.
customer_reviews.text: "This works so easily on my Bose docking station, I was tired of paying $50 for the lightning cords that always break. This works like a charm, highly recommended for anyone with old docking stations that aren't Bluetooth capable. "
customer_reviews.author: David J. OBrien

customer_reviews.title: and ah the old Bose sounddock sounded amazing, and no longer limited to what was on ...
customer_reviews.text: once I got the separate power adaptor the unit worked, linked up my phone, and ah the old Bose sounddock sounded amazing, and no longer limited to what was on the iPOD...Sadly that was the one and only time. It will no longer pair with my phone. I checked and my phone pairs with all other BT enabled items in the house. I was so bummed. Not sure if it was just a bad unit, should I try another one or not. Apparently lots of others have used the units successfully.
customer_reviews.author: FBARTNEK

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with my devices
customer_reviews.text: When connected to the iPod docking adapter on a Panasonic Home Theater System (Model SC-PT760) and also to an iPod adapter connected to the DOCK Input on a Yamaha Receiver (ModelRX-V1065), not able to play music from my Moto G4 Smart Phone nor from my Samsung Model SM-T330NU Tablet. When Paired with either device, the statement "Call Audio and Media Audio Only". Both these devices Pair with and Play music to any Bluetooth speaker. Should this Bluetooth Music Receiver Adapter actually operate as connected above?
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Keidel

customer_reviews.title: Works, but keep having to reset it
customer_reviews.text: It works in my non-bose speaker, but not in the bose speaker since I guess I have an older model. If I leave it plugging in and take a call in the house it tried to connect and I can't talk, and then when I go to play music later it won't even connect so I have to remove it and reinstall the whole thing. It also will not work in my Hyundai Sonata for the iphone connector. I tried it and it plays for about 30 seconds and then it can't seem to keep the connection or my car doesn't detect it. I will keep it, but I wish I had known these issues before.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. H.

customer_reviews.title: Works good with my Galaxy S4 and Bose Portable
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 2500 sq.ft. home and I'm able to listen to my music from anywhere in the house. I tested it from the furthest room upstairs to the furthest point downstairs and the music still plays clearly. Customer service was very good because initially, I was having a problem with it but they helped me work out the kinks (turns out the problem was with my Galaxy and NOT the device) so now I'm a happy customer. Response time with customer service was immediate and they kept in constant contact until issue was resolved. I think you'll be happy too with this little Bluetooth adaptor. It'll give new life to your speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Can't keep a bluetooth signal
customer_reviews.text: Constantly resets on me no matter what I do; returning as it won't maintain a signal. Music plays for a few seconds, then resets; my iPhone X has used around 20 bluetooth devices and this has never happened. Junky.
customer_reviews.author: Darion

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, as advertised!! I've had the Bose SoundDock Portable for several years now, and was seriously considering grabbing the new mini version Bose released (much smaller/thinner/less bass) for the pool/creek days strictly for its Bluetooth capabilities. One day I wondered if someone made an adapter, and found this thing.. I now continue to enjoy the superior sound of the SoundDock Portable with Bluetooth connectivity. You connect to the converter just as you have with any other Bluetooth-capable device. This is the best $20-something purchase I've made in a long time! Buy the damn thing already!! 😋
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bluetooth Adapter
customer_reviews.text: I took less than 30 seconds to connect the BMR A2DP to my iPhone 6+. A little less time to connect to my iPad. The connection with my Kindle Fire was a bit more difficult. The range on this device is exceptional. I live in a 3200 two floor sq.ft. house. The connection held when I moved my iPhone to all all four corners of the house both upstairs and down stairs. As noted in the questions section, this device will not work with my MacBook Air. This is the only downside that I see with the BMR A2DP
customer_reviews.author: CaptBobB

customer_reviews.title: Works on my BOSE speaker from 5 years ago
customer_reviews.text: This enabled me to continue using my BOSE speaker that I purchased over 5 years ago. I now can use my phone to play mushic through it versu having an old iPhone attached to it.
customer_reviews.author: M Hanks

customer_reviews.title: Save your Bose & $200
customer_reviews.text: Got an iPhone 6s wanted to use my sound odd but was not thrilled with the idea of being corded. Asked that my Bose store if I could get a Bluetooth adapter for my old perfectly operating sound dock. Bose offered to let me spend $250 and get a trade-in my old sound dock on a new sound dock that was wireless. This solution cost me 25 bucks work the first time works perfectly. Thank you highly recommend the product !
customer_reviews.author: J Rome

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for older Bose units!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Allowed me to dust off the Old Bose speaker that had been collecting dust since it didn't have bluetooth. Super easy set up and great sound! Note on the package reads that if you have a pre-2008 Bose you will need a power adapter. That wasn't an issue for me but thought I'd include the info should anyone need it!
customer_reviews.author: martha

customer_reviews.title: It might work for you, but better contact the seller first
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to say at this moment if the adapter works or not. I think it is just my case that this adapter simply doesn't work with my docking station. Once it is plugged in the station, it turns on and my iphone is able to recognize it. Sadly, it is not transmitting audio to the station, though. This is clearly a case of compatibility. I assume my responsability for nor actually writing to the seller to get more information. If your system is not in the list they provide in the description, I think your best bet is to write to the seller for more information about your dock station or look for other product.
customer_reviews.author: Sixaola

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but there is not an on/off switch/button. If it has been off for a while, you have to unplug it and plug it back in in order to turn it back on. Sounds great, Bluetooth range is pretty far, easy to pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BMR A2DP Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Received this really quick, had a IPhone 4 and used it on a JBL On StagelllP got a new IPhone 6+, realized new phone won't work on docking station, was looking for an adaptor 30pin to 8pin came across this, pairing was easy, plug in turn on speaker check phone for devices to pair wait until it shows up,boom its paired, nice thing about this you can control volume,change stations or songs with phone, also dont have to walk over to answer the phone, works well sounds great!!
customer_reviews.author: Samswift

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two. Easy set-up and works seamlessly. I even carried my phone upstairs and worked nearly through 3-4 walls and from bottom to top of a 2 story home.
customer_reviews.author: CJT

customer_reviews.title: A tiny miracle gadget
customer_reviews.text: I had a bose IPod speaker that had kind of outlived its usefulness...or so I thought. This little gadget was all it took to bring my speaker into the wireless Bluetooth world. I can now play Amazon prime music, my playlists and any other thing I want and get the sound that Bose is known for."
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible connect/disconnect tone scares dogs
customer_reviews.text: Is there a way to change or stop the connection / disconnect tone? It terrorizes my otherwise well adjusted dogs every time that I use it. I don't know if the sound also has some frequency that we humans otherwise cannot hear. If it were a "click" or "tap" or even no tone, then it would be OK. I just need to get rid of the tone that it is using now or stop using the device.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Certainly works with unexpectedly good range. Often needs a remove and insert (reset) ...
customer_reviews.text: Certainly works with unexpectedly good range. Often needs a remove and insert (reset) in my old Altec Lansing to regain previously paired phones/tablets. Latency is very good, I often don't notice any problems while making dinner and watching AvE...
customer_reviews.author: J. LARSON

customer_reviews.title: Very useful adapter
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in to my Bose Sound Dock. Pairing was fast and easy. Works beautifully for the most part. Only minor issues I have is that in between songs on Pandora there is a feedback like sound that emanates from the Sound Dock. Other small issue is that I have to remove and re-dock the adapter before each use so that my phone can find it. Might be something I am doing wrong but nothing else seems to work. Overall, I do love this product and can totally live with these minor issues. I would highly recommend this product to others who want to stream via a Bluetooth connection on their compatible Sound Dock.
customer_reviews.author: Shem

customer_reviews.title: Bose sound dock is no longer obsolete!
customer_reviews.text: I have the original Bose SoundDock and this was the perfect solution to pair with Alexa. Thing is, the original SoundDock does not provide power to this Bluetooth device so you will also need to purchase this Works perfectly. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Erbium

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed too
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to the new Apple format ie lighting usb most of the new apple products dont work with the old accessories such as the $200 Bose sound dock I own. Thanks to this not only can I use new apple products sync as iPhones and iTouches by syncing them up wireless but I can also use other Bluetooth devices. This product literally breathed life into my old dock which was collecting dust due to this usb change, I highly recommend to those who own older Bose docks, 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Eric John Buchner

customer_reviews.title: Worked the first few times it was used & now won’t work at all!
customer_reviews.text: This connected & worked the first few times I used it, but now it won’t connect anymore. Of course I am less than a week past my return period also. I would have given zero stars if I was able to because it doesn’t work properly.
customer_reviews.author: MeeShell888

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Sony marine head unit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with a Sony DSX-MS60 marine head unit with a 30-pin iPod connector to stream audio from an iPhone 7. The head unit displayed "No Dev" and would not stream music. Not the adapter's fault, but wanted to put that out there for anyone else who may be looking at this for their Sony head unit with a "Tune Tray."
customer_reviews.author: Luke W.

customer_reviews.title: It did NOT work with an iPod touch Bluetooth. ...
customer_reviews.text: It did NOT work with an iPod touch Bluetooth. that is why I purchased it. The picture showed my Bose. It did work with a Kindle tablet and my android phone. Be careful, it doe NOT work with a BOSE sound dock and an iPod touch. It will work with Android.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Cooney

customer_reviews.title: Would not work on my Bose Sounddock
customer_reviews.text: I had no choice but to have to return this product due to it being unreliable. It would not sync and then out of the blue and very random it would sync and then not work (unsync itself - weird). I'm only giving it a 1-star rating since it didn't work with my Bose sounddock.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great in Bose Soundmachine
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a couple Bose sound machine with 30 pins at a thrift shop for pennies. Now have Bluetooth music through out my home. Good range.
customer_reviews.author: orangebarn9

customer_reviews.title: The BMR is the best receiver I've found.
customer_reviews.text: This BMR bluetooth receiver is tops. It's super easy to connect and the range is excellent, at least 50-60 feet. If you elevate it 4-5 feet off the ground the range is even farther, close to 100'. Works really well with iphones and ipods with 30-pin connectors. The sound is also very crisp and clear.
customer_reviews.author: RZII

customer_reviews.title: BMR I am impressed! Thanks
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product on Thursday and it came on time, simple to use, I connected to it in one shot, awesome item so far, my Bose had no sound before because I lost the remote, docked the BMR to the sound dock and bam iPhone is playing wireless/Bluetooth like new money.👍🏾
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rich

customer_reviews.title: worked great til it didn't
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this adapter for my Bose SoundDock Series II less than a year ago. It worked fine until recently when it just stopped working. I tried all the troubleshooting suggestions but nothing helps. I cannot find a customer service phone # for BMR so I emailed customer support. I have not received a response. I wouldn't purchase this item or any item if I don't have a customer support phone #. BMR's customer service stinks.
customer_reviews.author: esandy

customer_reviews.title: line-of-site at best. It would not transmit through interior home walls
customer_reviews.text: Reception was decent but NOT even close to the advertised 60ft. Maybe 20-25 ft. line-of-site at best. It would not transmit through interior home walls. The product feels cheaply constructed and was not easy to connect to my Bose SoundDock, which must be unplugged after each use to avoid all phone notifications being transmitted through the speaker. Returned and purchased a CoolStream Duo, which is better made and will easily transmit through interior home walls.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.  Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The A2DP Bluetooth works great with the Bose Portable SoundDock. I bought this as a gift for my wife after she purchased the Iphone 5s that would no longer attach to the SoundDock (new adapter). The sound is impressive and you can connect from anywhere in the house. My wife uses it around the pool and it stays connected from as far as 25 yards away. It works great with my Windows Phone 8 Nokia 920. The price was excellent, beats purchasing a new Bluetooth sound system like the Jawbone for around $199.00 (I'm sure it is a great product). Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: One small catch for older Bose units.
customer_reviews.text: On my older Bose unit, I have to re-pair every time I am gone for any length of time. The only solution is to disconnect and reconnect the unit to get it to reacquire the phone. I'm sure over a period of time that the unit will wear out from all the repeated reconnection. So far the range is awesome. I love how it works once the re-pairing is done though.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Makes your expensive i-device platforms useable by other manufacturers
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the value considering it makes a $200 Bose system usable by multiple devices. Getting it to pair with my Ipad and Android takes a couple attempts which is a little annoying. And there is no on/off switch, so when it times out or shuts off for some reason when you aren't using it you need to remove and reinsert it to turn it back on and put it in pairing mode. It really seems to be the cheapest and most reliable way to get your expensive I-devices working with your Bluetooth devices. As far as range it reaches my entire house which is about 30 feet away in any one direction with a couple wall in between.
customer_reviews.author: Hikeaz

customer_reviews.title: Works great and seller (BMR) is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this adapter for my Bose SoundDock and I couldn't be happier with the product and the seller. I had a little problem with the adapter and after 2 days of testing, BMR sent me a new one. Unlike some sellers, they answered my e-mail in hours, not days. Do not be afraid to purchase this, you won't be sorry. It works as stated and couldn't ask for better support. I would definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Werner

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I had to with this purchase. I had an old Boss Sound Dock laying around that we never used due to the lightning jack on our new phones. Saw this on Amazon and decided to give it a shot. It came in the mail last night and I fired up the Bose. Paired my wife and my phones to it in minutes and we enjoyed the Bose goodness all night. We both kept playing songs from the good old 80's. This paired with the power adapter brought our original Bose sound dock to life. Couldn't recommend more.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Duerden

customer_reviews.title: I bought this specifically to use with my Bose Sound ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to use with my Bose Sound Dock II since most of our devices now have the lightning pin connections. It doesn't work with a single one of our devices. None of them will connect. I did get it to work with a portable speaker dock/clock thingy (don't remember the brand) in my daughter's room. So, I know the device works, but not for the speaker that I bought it for. Fairly irritating.
customer_reviews.author: ltnbrn

customer_reviews.title: Good, almost great
customer_reviews.text: Simple to connect and allows my Bose SoundDock to have far greater flexibility. My wife has the iphone but we can now use her newer iphone 6 and my android. My only complaint is a lack of power button. This may not seem like an issue until you realize that if you leave with your phone, or turn it off, the adapter will time-out and cannot be reconnected to until the SoundDock is either unplugged and re-plugged or the adapter is pulled and re-seated. Annoying but still nice to have this great Bose speaker system back in use
customer_reviews.author: Graham Moon

customer_reviews.title: Saved my SoundDock
customer_reviews.text: Very inexpensive solution for keeping an old-technology SoundDock relevant. Simple to use, works perfectly. Sounds as good as the wired connection.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Evans

customer_reviews.title: This was great until it broke 😢
customer_reviews.text: This was awesome but it was brittle and the outer casing broke after a short period. It kept working for awhile but eventually stopped
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES F LUEDEMANN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect  BT connectivity for apple pre lightning devices!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for our Bose speakers. We've been using a cable to connect which limited use of our iPhones. Connectivity was easy and quick and sound is great. Build quality is great
customer_reviews.author: R David Boardman

customer_reviews.title: Reccomended by Me!
customer_reviews.text: This little Bluetooth receiver is so handy for playing my music on my various smart devises wireless through my various docking stations and speakers. Very convenient and easy to use. I just started using it with my Yamaha PDX-11 30-Pin iPod/iPhone Speaker Dock, and love this set-up! I have also used it with my Pyle Home PHST94IPCW 600 Watt Digital 2.1 Channel Home Theater Tower with Docking Station for iPod/iPhone/iPad (Cherry Wood). I would also recommend both of these stereo/speaker systems for their sheer quality and volume!
customer_reviews.author: scienceguy

customer_reviews.title: did test this product on other docks and it works great! very little sound distortion (at loud loud volumes
customer_reviews.text: was exactly what I wanted. i had to return because my bose dock was before 2009 (i didn't read the details apparently) and had to order a different model. however, did test this product on other docks and it works great! very little sound distortion (at loud loud volumes, rock on!) great product, fast delivery, easy instructions, easy return. i ordered the bmr a2dp and LOVE it, too. just what i need to stream music at high volumes without having to buy a whole new sound dock.
customer_reviews.author: 3in2yrs

customer_reviews.title: then this will work just fine most of the time
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth adapter certainly saved me from completely losing my Bose SoundDock investment, however it is rather flakey (i.e. does not reliably/consistently work). Further, the remote control commands to not convey to the iPhone (e.g. you cannot fast forward, you cannot pause, etc.). If you're looking for nothing more than a Bluetooth-capable audio transmitter, then this will work just fine most of the time. Otherwise, look elsewhere...
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I connected the receiver to an older speaker of mine ...
customer_reviews.text: I connected the receiver to an older speaker of mine that only offered an iPhone 30 pin adapter and it worked flawlessly. In no time I was able to stream music from my phone through Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: C. C.-M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Connected my Bose Soundock Portable to my IPhone 5s, my, iPod and my IPad. Very easy and no problems. The range is impressive, however I have not measured it. One important thing about paring with your devices..... You cannot pair two devices at the same time. In order to change devices, the Bluetooth option must be turned off of the first paired device THEN the second device will pair easily. No problem at all, just a need to know when you are trying a different device and it "sees" the adapter but will not pair. It took me a while to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was kinda skeptical about purchasing this item. But glad i did. Simply plug pair and play. LOVE it ! Made my 7 year old BOSE system come alive. Super content with my purchase !
customer_reviews.author: AZLAM B

product_meta.title: BMR A2DP 4.1 Bluetooth Music Receiver Adapter for Bose SoundDock, 30 pin Docking Station, iPhone, Samsung, Nokia, HTC, LG, Echo Alexa
product_meta.description:
If you are tired of out of sync and need to re-sync when walking out of the bluetooth signal working range (~ 20 ft), this long wireless range 30 pin Bluetooth adapter is the solution.

This new Bluetooth 4.1 model enhances the wireless working distance (up to 70 ft) with a bigger antenna. This working distance, up to 70 ft, is twice of most similar devices sold on the market at ~18-22 ft.
(For some cell phone with weaker signal to save battery, wireless range is much improved with this new model. The wireless range of this model is ~ 1.5-2 times of most other models)

Known compatible speaker models: 
Altec Lansing iMT325, iMT620, iMT810, T612 
Beats by Dr. Dre, Beatbox 
Bose sounddockPortable, sounddock digital I, II, 10. it works for bose model made AFTER 2008
It does not work for Bose sounddock original 2004 model 
Edifier M360, M35, M0, MKII, 
Cyber Acoustics CA461 
Geneva Sound System Model L 
Harmon Kardon Go Play Stereo 
iHome iA100, iA17, iA5, iA63, iD37, iD8, iD91, iH16U, iH4, iH5, iH6, iP1, iP4, iP9, iP11, iP37 
iLuv iMM747 
JBL On Stage 3, On Stage 4, On Beat, On Beat Air, On Time 200P, On Time Micro
Logitech S135i, S315i, S715i, Pure Fi Anywhere 2, Pure Fi Anywhere, S-0001, S135i, S315i, S715i 
Memorex MA9010MS 
Onkyo DS-A4 - Philips DC320/37, DCB291, DCB293, DCB352, DCD132, DCM2020, DCM230/37, DS1100, DS1200, DS3000, DS3510, DS7700 
Polk HD Radio I-Sonic 
Pyle Home PiDock 1 
Skullcandy Skull Candy pipe, Vandal S7LACZ-04 
Sony AIR-SW10Ti, ICF-7iP, ICF-C05iP, ICF-C1iPMK2, ICF-CS10iP, RDP-M15iP, RDP-M5iP, RDP-V20iP 
Yamaha PDX-11, TSX-70

How to use: 
1:Plug this 30 pin bluetooth music receiver directly to iPod speaker 30 pin dock. 
2:Enable the bluetooth function in cell phone, tablets or PC. Search this BT devices , enter code 0000 if needed and pair.
3:Start play music wireless thru bluetooth cellphone/tablets
feature_bullets: BLUETOOTH TECHNOLOGY: Updated Model with Extra Long Bluetooth Wireless Range and Better 30 Pin Plug Design. This bluetooth receiver with up to 70 ft wireless range is the answer if tired of the out-of-sync buzzing sound when walk out of bluetooth wireless range. This new generation bluetooth adapter with much bigger antenna solves short wireless range issue. This model’s wireless distance is ~70 ft while other similar brand’s receivers is only around 15 ~ 30 ft.

PLUG, PAIR and PLAY: Can Pair With Two devices instead of One. Turn your iPhone, iPod, iPad speaker dock with Apple 30-pin connector into a wireless Bluetooth music system and freely listen to your playlist without docking your smartphone, tablet or Echo Alexa. This new model can pair two devices while most other models in the market can only pair one device. It can memorize up to 8 devices.

REVIVE 30 PIN BOSE SPEAKER: For BOSE Sounddock Speaker Made After 2008 Like Digital I, II, Portable, 10 * If your Bose speaker cannot charge iphone 3, 4 or 4S, or your Bose speaker was made before 2008, an extra or built-in power adapter is needed. Check http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00DA06Z3I or http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00Q65L660 for right product.

Also Work For Other Brand's Speakers. If your speaker can charge the battery of iPhone 3/4 or iPod touch through the 30 pin analog dock (not digital), this is the correct device for your speakers like Bose, Sony, JBL.... . Please see the compatible model list in the product description.

If your speaker model is not in the compatible list but with both 30 pin dock and aux audo input, The other model http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00Q65L660 will work. This model has on/off switch, 3.5mm audio output and even longer Bluetooth wireless range up to 75 ft.
